thematic in RStudio

Carson Sievert

2020-06-04

Source: vignettes/RStudio.Rmd
RStudio.Rmd

thematic_on() works everywhere in RStudio so long as you specify the colors and fonts (rendering Google Fonts requires very recent build of RStudio, though). Here’s a snippet of my .Rprofile, which applies automatic colors and the Fira Sans Condensed Google Font (a font that’s similar, but intentionally not the same my RStudio editor font, FiraCode). Note also that my RStudio theme in this screenshot is Tomorrow Night 80s, but since the colors are automatic, they adjust to whatever theme I happen to be using (the only exception is that accent='auto' doesn’t currently work with custom RStudio themes). It’s also worth noting that automatic font detection (i.e. font='auto') is supported on RStudio 1.4 or higher, but actual rendering of that font only works if it resolves to a Google Font (or a font that R/ragg already knows about).

if (interactive() && rstudioapi::isAvailable()) {
  thematic::thematic_on(font = "Fira Sans Condensed")
}

Rendering Google Fonts

Rendering Google Fonts in RStudio requires RStudio 1.4 (currently only available in the daily release) with an AGG graphics device backend, which requires the ragg package:

# install.packages("ragg")

To set the AGG backend, in RStudio, go to Tools -> Global Options -> Graphics -> Backend:

Auto theming support

Auto detection of background and foreground should always work in RStudio, but accent='auto' is currently limited to non-custom RStudio themes. Moreover, font='auto' is fully supported on RStudio Server Pro (1.4 or higher), but may not work on RStudio Desktop.
